OBS.-'I'his is an extensive and very distinct tribe of Ferns, differing from all others by the extremely delicate and in general thin pellucid texture of the fronds‚ and also by the form and attachment of the sporangia. The fronde vary much in form and size, some being simple entire, forked or flabelliform, not more than half an inch in length, while others are more or less compound, or multifidly divided into fine hair-like segments, and vary from a few inches to 1 or 13 feet in length.
